channel.title: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide
channel.description:
Well my girlfriend is like really close friends with this girl, and this girl's twin brother hung himself like 10 days ago. I haven't been active lately due to helping out with this whole thing, because everyone loved this kid and he never seemed like the kind of kid who would... anyways, the kids name is Kyle Ernst, if anyone has heard of this kid. This has had like a huge impact on our community and stuff like our schools are doing presentations on it, and his funeral was today. I went with my girlfriend and this girl who was his sister had to be carried in because she was crying so hard. Everyone was like bawling, and I was too. It was the saddest funeral I've ever been to. Stuff was awful.
Anyways, if anyone knows anyone contemplating suicide, please convince them it's not worth it. They are a loved person.

Chris.

I agree man, things like this shouldn’t be happening in the world. It makes me sad when i hear of a person who has attempted or has succeeded in killing themselves. We only live once ya know?

item.source: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide

item.title: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide
item.dc:creator: @R_A_R_E_S R A R E S
item.description:
@R_A_R_E_S wrote:

I’m terribly sorry for the loss man. I have a cousin ( around his early 30’s ) and his fiance hung herself as well and she had a kid with my cousin and everything. No one expected it to happen either, but we looked through her phone and a bunch of drunk women continually sent text to her, telling her that she was a bad mother. The next morning my cousin walks down stairs only to find her hung from the ceiling. It was a very sad moment as I’m sure yours was too.

Read full topic
item.source: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide

item.title: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“SETO, post:50, topic:384585”]its sad, how ppl decide things too fast, i agree when you are angry you don’t realize what you are doing, but before you do something, think about it, is your life really bad?, i mean so you get bullied at school, not cool, parent’s don’t care abt you?, well there are kids in the world that have to go though garbage to get something to eat everyday, and they are not giving up, why should you, you have a roof over your head, food on the table, and a free mind and a good potential to do anything you want to do.

I find it its peer pressure and misunderstanding that result in hasty teenage decisions[/quote]

Again, you don’t know any of use as far as personal knowing. You can’t sit their and state that we don’t have the right to be in some kind of depression, and depression isn’t through peer pressure, correct me if I’m wrong. I’ve never seen or heard of such a person to be through peer pressure, and call it depression.

Some kid that I knew at our school, that we held some big thing for killed herself because she was raped, and raped by her father, and her mother didn’t know a thing about it. And indeed she was a bit bullied at school, and her father told her if she ever told her mother; he would kill her. Now he is arrested and having to grieve about the whole thing, and her mother hates him. So please enough with all that non sense.

Read full topic
item.source: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide

item.title: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide
item.dc:creator: @PLayRooney PLayRooney
item.description:
@PLayRooney wrote:

I’m 14 and to be honest when ever i feel a bit down I pretty much attempt to make a joke about it. When i got bullied at school i use to just sit and ignore it. One day they said one thing to much and boom. I went physico And then i never got bullied again and i reckon that is one of the main reasons us teenagers get depressed.
OP; I feel for you man. Just try to stay away from the path your girlfriends friend twin brother chose. :\

Read full topic

its sad, how ppl decide things too fast, i agree when you are angry you don’t realize what you are doing, but before you do something, think about it, is your life really bad?, i mean so you get bullied at school, not cool, parent’s don’t care abt you?, well there are kids in the world that have to go though garbage to get something to eat everyday, and they are not giving up, why should you, you have a roof over your head, food on the table, and a free mind and a good potential to do anything you want to do.

I find it its peer pressure and misunderstanding that result in hasty teenage decisions

item.title: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:46, topic:384585”]Unleashed Revolution: It’s not because I don’t attempt to fix it, because I’m attempting to fix it alright, trust me, I can’t stand this bullshit much longer. You act like committing suicide is some kind of thing to do with ease, and it’s not. You can’t tell me what the hell you’ve been on because you act like it was of nothing, therefore don’t tell me it isn’t nothing.

Your a heartless person, and you have no right to tell me to get over it. You don’t know me what so ever, so don’t even attempt to tell me to get over it. Think before you act, sir.[/quote]
There just a bunch of fucked up little 12 year old’s is all.

Read full topic

item.title: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“ranger squad, post:42, topic:384585”]Also, about the painless method, overdose slightly on sleeping pills but not enough to kill you, and then lay in the bath. Make sure it is deep and then when you sleep you will be submerged, the overdose will stop you from waking up and you will drown.

Jumping off a building and shooting yourself in the head are painless.[/quote]
You are fucking unbelieveable.
Why would you say something like that on a thread like this?

@OP
Sorry to hear that, I’ve thought about suicide a couple time’s in my life, attempted once.

Read full topic
item.source: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide

item.title: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

Make it into a joke? I’ve been there and I hated the thought of dying in pain, so I researched every possible way that I could. I was only stopped because one of my friends told the school. I had a police officer in yesterday to talk to me about the gun, too.

Read full topic

item.title: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Cole1497:

Nowadays I’m all about correcting others mistakes, when I fail to see my own.

[URL]http://m.youtube.com/index?desktop_uri=%2F&gl=US#/watch?xl=xl_blazer&v=vBP0nkHIqrI[\URL]
seems appropriate.

I believe that is the most mature comment from a normal user ever posted on this site. Well done.
Also, very sorry for your loss. I find that when I get crazy thoughts like this, I go to the gym and box with friends. They have gloves n stuff, and just being able to take out all your anger through punching at people stronger then you really relieves stress.

Read full topic
item.source: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide

item.title: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide
item.dc:creator: @laurent_248 laurent 248
item.description:
@laurent_248 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:7, topic:384585”]Did he leave a note?

I think most teenagers at some time or another think about suicide. I’d be lying if I said I hadn’t more than once (usually after a fight with my parents), the thing is, if you ever do have thoughts like that, take a nap. Usually a good sleep makes me feel better. If you still have the same thoughts, you may need some counseling; maybe you are depressed?

Just remember, life exists outside of being a teenager, why not let it get better?

Sorry for your loss, it’s sad to see someone so young go.[/quote]

True, I did and sometimes I do again sometimes… Anyway I don’t think I will do

Read full topic
item.source: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide

item.title: Girlfriend's best friend's twin brother committed suicide
item.dc:creator: @Unleashed_Revolution Unleashed Revolution
item.description:
@Unleashed_Revolution wrote:

[quote=“Squirt Ltd, post:35, topic:384585”][quote author=Unleashed Revolution link=topic=480349.msg3517412#msg3517412 date=1299112324]
http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/desmoinesregister/obituary.aspx?n=kyle-ernst&pid=148885732

Depressing, really. [quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=480349.msg3516895#msg3516895 date=1299067174]
Dearest apologies about this loss, I’m not going to lie. I’ve attempted suicide about four times, and because of that. I’ve been in deep deep depression for the past nine months and mother doesn’t even seem to care or notice, not even others.

Your loss must of been a huge impact and I hope it doesn’t attempt others to commit suicide because if they fail (it will hurt anyway), but it they fail, it will make a huge impact of them and become in bad depression.

Please don’t hesitate to come talk to me, I know I’m in deep depression, but I still love to help others with the kind of same problems I have, and others who’ve seen such loss.

Nephew’s Uncle committed suicide about three months ago because of our disease in our family blood, and he couldn’t take it anymore. So I will have the same idea of the pain and will know how it is like.

Much Prayers.
[/quote]
I’m not trying to be a dick but I wouldn’t care if I was your mom either. If you really wanted to kill yourself, you would have done so. There are many effective ways of doing so that involves no pain at all…
[/quote]

no pain at all? what ways?[/quote]
Tylenol PM, around 40 pills. Tylenol ES, around 30. OD is around 8 pills for both. I know people that died from both and they felt nothing (according to the doctors) but that is controversial.

[quote=“n10si t, post:36, topic:384585”][quote author=Unleashed Revolution link=topic=480349.msg3517412#msg3517412 date=1299112324]
I’m not trying to be a dick but I was one anyways
[/quote][/quote]
I don’t see how? If you really wanted to attempt suicide, you wouldn’t fail four times.

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:38, topic:384585”][quote author=Unleashed Revolution link=topic=480349.msg3517412#msg3517412 date=1299112324]
http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/desmoinesregister/obituary.aspx?n=kyle-ernst&pid=148885732

Depressing, really. [quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=480349.msg3516895#msg3516895 date=1299067174]
Dearest apologies about this loss, I’m not going to lie. I’ve attempted suicide about four times, and because of that. I’ve been in deep deep depression for the past nine months and mother doesn’t even seem to care or notice, not even others.

Your loss must of been a huge impact and I hope it doesn’t attempt others to commit suicide because if they fail (it will hurt anyway), but it they fail, it will make a huge impact of them and become in bad depression.

Please don’t hesitate to come talk to me, I know I’m in deep depression, but I still love to help others with the kind of same problems I have, and others who’ve seen such loss.

Nephew’s Uncle committed suicide about three months ago because of our disease in our family blood, and he couldn’t take it anymore. So I will have the same idea of the pain and will know how it is like.

Much Prayers.
[/quote]
I’m not trying to be a dick but I wouldn’t care if I was your mom either. If you really wanted to kill yourself, you would have done so. There are many effective ways of doing so that involves no pain at all…
[/quote]
People like you are whom make things worse, don’t even have a heart or bother to care. So don’t tell me what I could do because I’m trying, and I’m still in pain. Step into my shoes and then tell me their is a more efficient way of doing things.[/quote]
I was on prozac for 2 1/2 years. Please, by all means, don’t bs me with that. If you wanted to commit suicide and fully go through with it, you would of done so. A 10 year old could go to a local pharmacy and buy a lot of over the counter drugs and successfully go through with it. I don’t know you but I’ve no doubt that your life is pretty hard but instead of complaining about it, why not make something of it? You can of course give me reasons why that isn’t possible or how you don’t want to but in the end; what is the real reason? Laziness? Physical/Emotional Abuse? Pressure? Maybe all of them. Get over it. I may sound like a ass but what is being a emo (or whatever term that you want to use, I don’t care as that is what society labels people that suffer depression) going to accomplish in the long run? Nothing. I learned that the hard way when I turned 18.

Read full topic

Depressing, really. [quote author=Ix Soulcist xI link=topic=480349.msg3516895#msg3516895 date=1299067174]
Dearest apologies about this loss, I’m not going to lie. I’ve attempted suicide about four times, and because of that. I’ve been in deep deep depression for the past nine months and mother doesn’t even seem to care or notice, not even others.

Your loss must of been a huge impact and I hope it doesn’t attempt others to commit suicide because if they fail (it will hurt anyway), but it they fail, it will make a huge impact of them and become in bad depression.

Please don’t hesitate to come talk to me, I know I’m in deep depression, but I still love to help others with the kind of same problems I have, and others who’ve seen such loss.

Nephew’s Uncle committed suicide about three months ago because of our disease in our family blood, and he couldn’t take it anymore. So I will have the same idea of the pain and will know how it is like.

Much Prayers.
[/quote]
I’m not trying to be a dick but I wouldn’t care if I was your mom either. If you really wanted to kill yourself, you would have done so. There are many effective ways of doing so that involves no pain at all…[/quote]
People like you are whom make things worse, don’t even have a heart or bother to care. So don’t tell me what I could do because I’m trying, and I’m still in pain. Step into my shoes and then tell me their is a more efficient way of doing things.
